items.title: Syfe bids $40.7m to acquire Australian platform Selfwealth
items.summary:
- Syfe, a Singapore-based investment platform, has made a non-binding offer to acquire Australian digital investment platform Selfwealth for A$65 million (US$40.7 million).
- The acquisition aims to integrate Selfwealth's platform into Syfe while maintaining its independent brand.
- This move is part of Syfe's 2024 growth strategy through acquisitions.

items.title: Snap Q4 revenue up 14%, users rise to 453m
items.summary:
- Snap Inc. reported Q4 adjusted earnings of 16 cents per share, exceeding expectations of 14 cents.
- Revenue increased by 14% to $1.56 billion, surpassing the estimate of $1.55 billion.
- Daily active users rose by 9% year-over-year to 453 million, exceeding the forecast of 450.8 million.
- Investments in AI and machine learning enhanced Snap's advertising platform, benefiting revenue from small and mid-sized businesses.

items.title: Travel platform Trivago partner to enable crypto bookings
items.summary:
- Trivago has partnered with Travala to enable accommodation bookings using cryptocurrency.
- This partnership adds over 2.2 million properties in 230 countries to Trivago’s platform.
- Users can pay with more than 100 cryptocurrencies, including bitcoin and ether.
- Travala members will be redirected to Trivago for bookings and to access discounts through its AVA Smart Program.
- This collaboration expands Travala’s presence alongside major platforms like Expedia and Booking.com, promoting cryptocurrency adoption in travel.

items.title: Hong Kong watchdog proposes staff boost for crypto hub
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- Hong Kong's financial regulator is seeking to increase its staffing to manage the burgeoning cryptocurrency sector.
- The proposal comes in response to a surge in crypto companies setting up in Hong Kong amidst regulatory changes.
- The initiative is part of broader efforts to position Hong Kong as a leading global crypto hub.

items.title: Musk sues OpenAI over profit shift, citing mission concerns
items.author: Elon Musk
items.summary:
- Elon Musk has filed a lawsuit against OpenAI over its transition from a nonprofit to a for-profit entity, scheduled to be heard on Feb. 5, 2025.
- Musk claims this shift undermines OpenAI's original mission to benefit humanity and has included federal antitrust allegations.
- OpenAI argues that the restructuring is necessary to attract capital for advancing its AI models.

items.title: Indian furniture retailer Pepperfry’s revenue drops 30.6%
items.summary:
- Pepperfry, an Indian furniture retailer, reported a revenue decline of 30.6%.
- The drop in revenue reflects challenging market conditions and consumer demand issues.
- This significant decrease may impact future operations and growth plans for Pepperfry.

items.title: Indian hair extension startup raises $5m series A
items.author: Jitendra Sharma, Piyush Wadhwani
items.summary:
- Hair Originals, a D2C brand for hair extensions and wigs, raised $5 million in a series A funding round.
- The round was co-led by Anicut Growth Fund and 12 Flags Consumer Holdings, with participation from Lenskart CEO Peyush Bansal.
- The funding will be used to expand the "try-at-home" service to 40 cities and to open 25-30 experience centers in the upcoming year.
- Some funds will also go towards R&D for enhancing product quality.
- Founded in 2019, Hair Originals offers ethically sourced human hair products and has partnered with over 1,400 salons in India and North America.

items.title: Amazon expands renewable energy with 476 MW purchase
items.summary:
- Amazon signed agreements to purchase 476 MW of renewable energy in the Iberian Peninsula from Iberdrola.
- Energy will support Amazon's planned data centers, sourced from wind and solar projects.
- Projects include the Tâmega wind farm in Portugal and installations in northwestern Spain.

items.title: Xiaomi hits $128.4b valuation as EV expansion boosts stock
items.summary:
- Xiaomi's stock reached an all-time high, with valuation surpassing HK$1 trillion (US$128.4 billion).
- Shares rose 5.7% to HK$40.10 (US$5.14) before closing at HK$39.55 (US$5.08).
- The EV division reported 39,790 SU7 deliveries in Q3 2024, contributing to a 31% revenue increase to 92.5 billion yuan (US$12.8 billion), including 9.7 billion yuan (US$1.34 billion) from EV sales.
- A second plant in Beijing is being built to meet demand, targeting 300,000 EV deliveries by 2025.
- Since its 2018 IPO, Xiaomi’s valuation has increased by 215%.

items.title: AppsFlyer lays off 100 employees ahead of IPO
items.summary:
- AppsFlyer, an Israeli marketing analytics company, lays off 100 employees, representing 7% of its workforce.
- CEO Oren Kaniel highlights the need for innovation and competitiveness in the market.
- The layoffs are a preparatory step for a potential IPO, aiming to raise approximately US$300 million.
- Affected employees will receive special pay packages to assist in their transition.

items.title: Alphabet unveils $75b AI investment plan for 2025
items.summary:
- Alphabet plans to invest approximately $75 billion in capital expenditures in 2025 to enhance its AI infrastructure.
- This investment exceeds the $59.73 billion consensus estimate from Visible Alpha.
- Spending will focus on technical infrastructure such as servers, data centers, and networking, with $16 to $18 billion expected in Q1 2025.

items.title: Saudi AI learning platform secures six-figure funding
items.author: Ahmed Al-Mashhadi
items.summary:
- Saudi Arabia-based AI startup vminds.ai has secured a six-figure pre-seed funding round from undisclosed angel investors.
- The funding will support the official launch of its platform for individuals and the rollout of its enterprise platform in Q3 2025.
- Vminds.ai provides a self-learning platform that aggregates over 150 AI tools, including generative AI and AI-driven insights.
- The company is affiliated with startup programs from Microsoft and NVIDIA and aims to expand regionally and globally while establishing partnerships with technology providers and investors.

items.title: Meta expands AI assistant to MENA, supports Arabic users
items.summary:
- Meta has launched its AI assistant, Meta AI, in the MENA region including UAE, Saudi Arabia, Egypt, Morocco, and Iraq.
- The assistant is integrated into Meta’s apps, accessible without prior registration.
- Users can activate it via a blue circle icon or by mentioning "@Meta AI" in group chats for tasks like brainstorming.
- Supports Arabic to enhance accessibility in the region.
- Future updates may include image editing, personalized portraits, and caption generation.
- Currently serves 700 million people in 42 countries and supports 13 languages globally.

items.title: US TikTok ban pushes SEA merchants to Amazon, Etsy
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- Southeast Asian merchants shift to platforms like Amazon and Etsy due to the US TikTok ban.
- The ban has led to a decrease in sales for many small businesses reliant on TikTok for promotion.
- Merchants are adapting to new marketing strategies to reach customers on alternative platforms.

items.title: Indonesian VC Alpha JWC marks 10 years, plans fourth fund
items.summary:
- Alpha JWC Ventures celebrates 10th anniversary, impacting Indonesia's startup ecosystem since 2015.
- The firm manages assets worth US$645 million and has invested in nearly 100 startups.
- Plans to raise a fourth fund focusing on consumer and healthcare sectors while remaining sector-agnostic.
- Enhanced leadership includes Ray Frederick Djajadinata and Satria Situmorang joining the team.
- Recent investments include significant funding rounds in agritech and SaaS sectors.

items.title: Apple launches new invites app for easier event invitations
items.summary:
- Apple has launched a new app called Apple Invites for creating and sharing event invitations on iPhone.
- The app is available from February 5 and can be downloaded from the App Store or accessed at icloud.com/invites.
- iCloud+ subscribers can design custom invitations and manage event details with features like Shared Albums for photo contributions and support for collaborative playlists via Apple Music.
- The app also integrates with Apple Maps and Weather for event planning.

items.title: Indian logistic firm Shadowfax adds directors to prepare IPO
items.author: Bijou Kurien, Ruchira Shukla, Pirojshaw Sarkari
items.summary:
- Shadowfax appoints three independent directors in preparation for IPO.
- Aims to raise ₹2,500 to ₹3,000 crore (US$286.96 million to US$344.36 million) through IPO.
- Expected company valuation between ₹5,000 to ₹8,000 crore (US$573.93 million to US$918.28 million).
- New directors bring experience in logistics, retail, and venture capital.
- Founded in 2015, Shadowfax provides last-mile delivery services for clients like Nykaa, Flipkart, and Meesho.
- Recently acquired CriticaLog to enhance delivery services.

items.title: US AI safety institute head Elizabeth Kelly resigns
items.summary:
- Elizabeth Kelly is resigning from her position as head of the United States AI Safety Institute by the end of this week.
- She has been leading the institute since its creation nearly a year ago, but has not provided comments on her departure.
- The institute, part of the Commerce Department, was established in 2023 following an executive order by former President Joe Biden to address risks associated with advanced AI systems.

items.title: Adtech platform Bigabid secures $25m series A
items.summary:
- Bigabid raised US$25 million in a series A funding round led by MobilityWare.
- The funding will enhance offerings in mobile performance marketing.
- Founded in 2015, Bigabid operates a Demand Side Platform analyzing data from over 2 billion devices every minute.
- The company had previously raised US$3 million in a Seed round in 2016.
- It generates over 1 million predictions per second, servicing clients like Playtika and Zynga.
- Bigabid employs about 100 staff and has reported annual revenue doubling.
- The investment will aid in developing machine learning models for better ad targeting and expanding the development team.

items.title: Adobe adds AI assistant to simplify contract understanding
items.summary:
- Adobe has introduced new Acrobat AI Assistant features for contract understanding.
- The assistant summarizes complex terms and is available on desktop, web, and mobile.
- Currently supports only English; plans for more languages are underway.
- Users can access this feature via a $4.99 monthly add-on for both free and paid accounts.

items.title: Honda moves to make Nissan a subsidiary, sources say
items.summary:
- Honda Motor plans to acquire shares in Nissan Motor to make it a subsidiary.
- Discussions on business integration started in December, initially considering a joint holding company.
- A mid-February deadline has been set for further negotiations based on Nissan's restructuring progress.
- Honda seeks to accelerate decision-making for operational turnaround, while Nissan advocates for an equal partnership.
- There are reports of internal resistance to Honda's proposal.

items.title: Ola founder invests $230m in Indian AI startup Krutrim
items.summary:
- Ola founder invested $230 million in Indian AI startup Krutrim.
- This investment highlights the growing interest in AI technology in India.
- Krutrim focuses on AI solutions to enhance various industries.

items.title: Dubai-based AI firm qeen.ai secures $10m seed funding
items.author: Morteza Ibrahimi, Ahmad Khwileh, Dina Alsamhan
items.summary:
- qeen.ai has raised US$10 million in seed funding, one of the largest in the MENA region.
- The investment was led by Prosus Ventures, totaling US$12 million with additional support from Wamda Capital, 10x Founders, and Dara Holdings.
- Founded in 2023 by former Google and DeepMind employees, qeen.ai focuses on developing AI agents for ecommerce.
- The funding will aid in expanding their platform, growing the team, and acquiring customers.
- Since launching its Dynamic Content agent in 2024, qeen.ai has created over 1 million product descriptions and achieved a 30% increase in sales.

items.title: Egyptian fintech Khazna secures $16m pre-series B
items.author: Omar Saleh, Ahmed Wagueeh, Fatimah El Shenawy
items.summary:
- Khazna raised US$16 million in pre-series B funding.
- The funding will facilitate expansion into Saudi Arabia and obtaining a digital banking license in Egypt.
- Investors included SANAD Fund for MSME, anb Seed Fund, Aljazira Capital, and others.
- Founded in 2020, Khazna provides financial services like credit and BNPL options to underbanked Egyptians.
- The company had previously raised US$38 million during its series A in March 2020.

items.title: US ethereum ETFs hit $1.5b record volume amid Trump tariffs
items.summary:
- On Feb. 3, US spot ethereum ETFs reached a record trading volume of $1.5 billion, up from $1.22 billion in December 2024.
- The spike occurred during a wider downturn in the crypto market.
- Ether experienced a 36% drop to $2,100 on Feb. 3 following new tariffs announced by President Trump.
- Ether rebounded by 30% to $2,819 by Feb. 5 after some tariffs were postponed.
- Ethereum ETFs recorded $83.6 million in net inflows, while US spot bitcoin ETFs saw $234.4 million in outflows.

items.title: Philippine ecommerce enabler Etaily hits $100m annual revenue
items.summary:
- Etaily, a Philippine ecommerce solutions provider, has reached US$100 million in annual recurring revenue since its founding in 2020.
- The company is backed by investors including Ayala Corporation and the Gokongwei group.
- Etaily plans to expand into Southeast Asia, starting with Singapore, offering services in omni-channel retail integration.
- In 2023, it secured US$17.8 million in series A funding to enhance its technology and support expansion.
- Lester Cuneta has been appointed as chief growth officer to guide Etaily's market strategies.
- The company partnered with PiMerce to boost operational efficiency through data-driven insights.

items.title: Australia bans DeepSeek on government devices
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- The Australian government has banned DeepSeek, a Chinese AI firm, on government devices due to security concerns.
- The Department of Home Affairs issued the directive for immediate removal of DeepSeek products from government systems.
- Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke stated the ban is a national security measure, effective from Feb. 4, affecting only government entities, not private citizens.

items.title: Spotify reports $1.17b first annual profit for 2024
items.summary:
- Spotify has reported its first full year of profitability since 2008, with net profits of €1.14 billion (US$1.17 billion) for 2024.
- This profit marks a significant improvement from a loss of €532 million (US$549 million) the previous year.
- Total annual revenue for 2024 reached €15.6 billion (US$16.1 billion), up from €13.2 billion (US$13.6 billion) in 2023.
- Premium subscribers increased by 11% YoY, growing from 236 million to 263 million.
- Monthly active users rose by 12% to 675 million.

items.title: PayPal stock drops 10% due to slow growth, competition
items.summary:
- PayPal’s shares fell nearly 10% on Feb. 4 due to a slowdown in unbranded card processing growth.
- Fourth-quarter results showed a contraction in operating margins and a decline in unbranded payments growth to 2%.
- Branded products, including Venmo, grew by only 6%.
- Investor concerns heightened about maintaining strong profit margins amid competition from companies like Apple, Google, Visa, and Mastercard.

items.title: Gobi-Core Philippine Fund adds two startups to portfolio
items.summary:
- Gobi-Core Philippine Fund announced milestones for 2024, emphasizing its role in the local startup ecosystem.
- The fund added two companies, Humble Sustainability and ProCredit Financing Corp, to its portfolio.
- 80% of its Philippine portfolio companies reported valuation increases, contributing to a 52% year-on-year revenue growth.
- The fund organized a startup learning tour with the National Development Company to foster knowledge sharing and partnerships with Malaysian startups.

items.title: Tazapay aims to triple revenue in 2025 with stablecoin bet
items.author: Rahul Shinghal, Arul Kumaravel, Saroj Mishra
items.summary:
- Tazapay raised US$17 million in Series A funding led by Peak XV Partners in 2023.
- Revenue grew over 3x to US$6.2 million for the fiscal year ending March 2024.
- Despite growth, pre-tax losses widened by 16%, though losses as a percentage of revenue declined.
- The company aims to triple revenue to US$14 million in 2025, driven by stablecoin adoption.
- Tazapay, founded in 2020, serves clients in travel, fintech, ecommerce, online gaming, and SaaS industries.
- Launched multicurrency wallets for merchants and acquired a payment institution license in Singapore.

items.title: Taxi-hailing app HKTaxis to close in April
items.summary:
- HKTaxi will cease operations on April 1, 2025.
- Founded in 2013, the app has begun suspending user accounts and notifying users through the app.
- Users are encouraged to switch to Uber, with a promotional offer of HK$100 off their first five rides as part of the transition.

items.title: Ola Group’s AI firm launches first frontier research AI lab
items.summary:
- Krutrim, a leading AI company in India, has launched the Krutrim AI Lab as the country’s first AI frontier research lab.
- The initiative aims to advance AI research, develop models for Indic languages, and improve AI infrastructure needs.
- An initial investment of 2,000 crore rupees (US$230 million) has been made, with plans to invest a total of 10,000 crore rupees (US$1.15 billion) by 2026.
- The lab will collaborate with academic institutions, developers, and startups to promote AI research.
- It will focus on creating datasets for low-resource environments and tailoring AI systems to meet India's specific requirements.

items.title: SG-based Cocoon Capital commences fundraising for Fund III
items.summary:
- Cocoon Capital has started fundraising for Fund III, focusing on pre-seed and seed investments in B2B deeptech startups in Southeast Asia.
- Each investment can reach up to US$1.5 million, with plans for around five investments annually.
- The firm reviewed over 3,000 deals and expanded its reach to Australia, India, and Bangladesh.
- Portfolio companies have achieved significant milestones, such as Shomvob gaining over a million users shortly after funding.
- Several companies, including Transtrack and Aprisium, secured new funding rounds in 2024.
- Cocoon Capital will support early-stage startups and host events throughout 2025.

items.title: EFishery confirms alleged fraud, FTI Consulting takes over
items.summary:
- The board of Indonesian aquatech unicorn eFishery confirmed allegations of misconduct and fraud.
- FTI Consulting will take over as acting management after receiving shareholder approval.
- The company plans a thorough business review and has made difficult decisions regarding operational costs; the number of layoffs is currently unclear.

items.title: Indian data center firm unveils genAI chatbot using DeepSeek
items.summary:
- Yotta Data Services has launched myShakti, India’s first sovereign B2C generative AI chatbot.
- myShakti is built using the open-source DeepSeek AI model and operates entirely on Indian servers for data security.
- It was developed in four days using 128 H100 GPUs at the NM1 data center, aiming to democratize AI access while addressing national data sovereignty.

items.title: Airbus hires Goldman for new space venture to rival Musk
items.summary:
- Airbus SE is collaborating with Goldman Sachs to establish a new European space and satellite company.
- The venture aims to compete with SpaceX and involves partnership with Thales and Leonardo SpA.
- Known as Project Bromo, this initiative is currently in the exploratory phase without a finalized service portfolio.
- The move reflects an increasing urgency within Europe’s aerospace sector to consolidate resources in response to SpaceX's advancements.

items.title: Vietnam puts its chips on AI
items.summary:
- Vietnam has launched the Investment Support Fund to attract global investments in AI and semiconductors.
- The fund offers unique incentives, such as lower capital requirements for AI data centers and semiconductor firms.
- Companies that provide training for high-skilled engineers may receive additional incentives, including direct reimbursement for R&D and training costs.
- Challenges remain in attracting tech giants due to talent shortages, infrastructure issues, and regulatory uncertainties.

items.title: MobiKwik reports $6.35m loss in Q3
items.summary:
- MobiKwik reported a consolidated net loss of 55.28 crore rupees (US$6.35 million) for Q3 FY25.
- This loss marks a significant decline from a profit of 5.27 crore rupees (US$607) in the same period last year.
- The company's net loss increased from 3.59 crore rupees (US$427) in the previous quarter.
- EBITDA was a loss of 42.67 crore rupees (US$4.92 million), down from a profit of 10.82 crore rupees (US$1.25 million) in Q3 FY24.
- Operating revenue grew nearly 18% year-on-year to 269.47 crore rupees (US$31.16 million) from 228.93 crore rupees (US$26.39 million) in the previous year.

items.title: Zomato shares fall 4%
items.summary:
- Zomato’s shares fell nearly 4% during intraday trading on Feb. 4, reaching 229.35 rupees (US$2.63) on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
- The drop resulted in a market capitalization of 2,24,032 crore rupees (US$25.75 billion), with over 2.28 crore (22.8 million) shares traded by 11:58 AM.
- Year to date, Zomato’s stock has declined by about 16%.
- Shares recovered slightly, trading 2.5% lower at 232.05 rupees (US$2.66) each on the BSE by the time of this report.

items.title: Grab, GoTo in talks for potential merger by 2025: sources
items.summary:
- Grab Holdings Ltd. and GoTo Group are in advanced discussions for a potential merger by the end of 2025.
- Both companies are key players in Southeast Asia’s ride-hailing market, which serves over 650 million consumers.
- The merger aim is to reduce costs and address competition amid increasing financial pressures.
- Past negotiations faced challenges due to disagreements and antitrust concerns.

items.title: Meet the 100 top-funded startups and tech companies in China
Nintendo profit misses forecast, cuts Switch sales outlook
items.summary:
- Nintendo reported Q3 fiscal results for December 2024, with revenue at 432.92 billion yen, missing projections.
- Net profit dropped 6% year-on-year to 128.53 billion yen, also below forecasts.
- The company cut its full-year Switch sales forecast to 11 million units and lowered net profit outlook by 10%. 
- Nintendo is focusing on its next-gen console, tentatively named Switch 2, with details expected on April 2.

items.title: Asia tech stocks rise as Trump pauses Canada, Mexico tariffs
items.summary:
- Asian technology stocks gained on Feb. 4 after President Trump paused tariffs on Mexico and delayed Canadian tariffs for one month.
- This decision led to a recovery in US tech stocks late on Feb. 3.
- Semiconductor companies in Japan drove the rally, with TSMC and Foxconn up by 2.8%.
- South Korean tech stocks and Chinese tech giants in Hong Kong also performed strongly.
- Gains occurred despite ongoing tariff concerns, with US tariffs on China still in effect.

items.title: Google Integrates Chat Messaging with Search App in India
items.summary:
- Google launched a pilot program in India integrating RCS with the Google Search app.
- Users can connect with businesses through AI chat or live agents via SMS.
- RCS enhances SMS with multimedia features like images and location sharing.
- Union Bank of India is among the first to test this service.
- The initiative could strengthen RCS as a competitor to WhatsApp in India's messaging market.
- Google is also expanding its presence in India with various initiatives.

items.title: Priyanka Gill resigns from Kalaari Capital to launch own brand
items.summary:
- Priyanka Gill has decided to resign from her position at Kalaari Capital.
- She plans to start her own brand following her departure.
- The move indicates a shift in her career towards entrepreneurship.

items.title: Kakao partners with OpenAI to integrate AI into messaging
items.summary:
- Kakao Corp. partners with OpenAI to integrate ChatGPT and AI services into KakaoTalk.
- Announcement made during OpenAI CEO Sam Altman’s visit to Seoul.
- Focus on developing joint products and applying OpenAI’s technology across Kakao’s platforms.
- Partnership aims to commercialize AI and collaborate with local tech firms.
- Altman is touring Asia and announced a similar partnership with SoftBank in Tokyo.
- Plans to meet with tech leaders from SK Group, SK Telecom, SK Hynix, and Samsung Electronics.

items.title: Indian EV firms extend range to SEA
items.summary:
- Indian EV startups are expanding into Southeast Asia, driven by sector growth and potential market opportunities.
- Companies like Kazam, Zypp, and Exicom are entering a region dominated by Chinese brands.
- Indonesia has been noted as both a promising and challenging market, with BYD capturing 36% market share in just seven months.
- Electric vehicle sales in Indonesia have risen significantly, with EV cars reaching 5% of the total car sales in 2024.
- Local preferences for 7-seater vehicles influence market strategies, with BYD introducing the M6 model to cater to these needs.

items.title: 50 rising startups in China
items.summary:
- The article highlights a list of startups in China that have recently raised funding rounds.
- The focus is on companies up to the series E funding stage.
- The list is updated constantly based on data aggregated by Tech in Asia.

items.title: China to investigate Google for antitrust case
items.summary:
- China has initiated an antitrust investigation into Google.
- The investigation is part of a broader scrutiny of foreign tech firms operating in China.
- Google has faced criticism over its dominance in various markets, prompting regulatory concerns.
